channel.title: NYT > Fashion > Love
channel.copyright: Copyright 2022 The New York Times Company

item.title: ‘It Was Magic From the First Second’
item.description: When Chelsea White, a writer and producer, first met Tash Neal, a musician, their attraction was instant. By the end of their first date, he felt “butterflies” and she found her “dream man.”
item.dc:creator: Nina Reyes
item.media:credit: Alexandra Genova for The New York Times
item.media:description: Chelsea White and Tash Neal were married July 30 at the Bordone LIC in Long Island City, Queens.

item.title: Seeking Marriage Equality for People With Disabilities
item.description: When one partner is disabled and the other isn’t, getting married could mean giving up lifesaving health care and benefits from the government.
item.dc:creator: Tammy La Gorce
item.media:credit: Clara Mokri for The New York Times
item.media:description: Lori Long and Mark Contreras of Salinas, Calif., have been engaged since December 2016, but have been reluctant to marry out of fear Ms. Long would lose her health benefits.

item.title: He Wanted Out of the ‘Friend Zone’, but She Took the Lead
item.description: When Andrew Zbihley first met Olivia Pura at Northwestern, he thought that Ms. Pura, a beauty queen, was out of his league. Years later, she made the first move.
item.dc:creator: Jenny Block
item.media:credit: Nancy Andrews for The New York Times
item.media:description: Olivia Pura and Andrew Zbihley opted for a first touch rather than a first look before their July 2 wedding in Pittsburgh.

item.title: Roving Weddings Take Guests on a Ride
item.description: Couples who want to savor as much of a wedding day as possible are organizing chauffeured excursions to see sights, bar hop and shop with their guests.
item.dc:creator: Perri Ormont Blumberg
item.media:description: Instead of choosing the typical wedding format of ceremony followed by reception, Megan and Craig Pyndinski caravanned with their 14 guests in super jeeps to at least a half-dozen locations after being married in Iceland in September 2021.

item.title: What It’s Like to Date in the Metaverse
item.description: Just a girl looking for love in the metaverse.
item.dc:creator: Madeleine Aggeler

item.title: He Handles Crises for a Living. She Solved One He Couldn’t: Changing the Channel.
item.description: Elizabeth Akeley, a flight attendant, had one rule about dating passengers — she didn’t. But after meeting P.R. executive George Regan during a flight to Jupiter, Fla., his sense of humor made her reconsider.
item.dc:creator: Tammy La Gorce
item.media:credit: Vanessa Leroy for The New York Times
item.media:description: Elizabeth Akeley and George Regan were all smiles aboard the tugboat S.S. Lollipop after their wedding ceremony at the Nauticus Marina in Osterville, Mass., on July 30.

item.title: How Couples Are Incorporating Pickeball Into Their Weddings
item.description: As pickleball rides a wave of popularity, couples are marrying on courts, hosting games at their receptions and finding other ways to incorporate the sport into their nuptials.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Simon

item.title: Near Castle Ruins, a Wedding with a Dash of ‘Game of Thrones’
item.description: After matching on Bumble, Kristen Sanders, a police officer, and April Hill, a makeup artist, began a courtship that ended with a marriage ceremony overlooking Dunluce Castle, in Northern Ireland.
item.dc:creator: Jenny Block
item.media:credit: Therese Aherne for The New York Times
item.media:description: April Hill, left, and Kristen Sanders were married June 18 at a private property in Bushmills, Northern Ireland, near the ruins of Dunluce Castle.

item.title: New York Times Wedding Feature Submission Form: Apply Here
item.description: You may also have questions about how this process works. We have answers.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times
item.media:credit: L. R. Legwin/Hulton Archive, via Getty Images

item.title: At Karaoke and as a Couple, Always in Unison
item.description: Zohar Fuller and Maryse Pearce, who bonded in part over a love of theater, started dating soon after they performed a duet of “Build Me Up Buttercup” at karaoke.
item.dc:creator: Valeriya Safronova

item.title: When a Dating App Didn’t Work, an Old-Fashioned Setup Did
item.description: Shafin Fattah first encountered Luvana Chowdhury on a Muslim dating app, but she never responded when he expressed interest. Months later, at the suggestion of a mutual friend, they had a first date.
item.dc:creator: Kristen Bayrakdarian

item.title: From the First Date, Looking the Part of Husband and Wife
item.description: Caroline Hubbard and Michael McMillan II met when he ran into her at a bar. On their first date, there were already signs of a future together.
item.dc:creator: Emma Grillo

item.title: Finding Common Ground in Their Childhoods on Farms
item.description: Midwestern roots, pumpkin pie and a prizewinning pig helped seal the deal for Sara Bunting and Adam Rouse.
item.dc:creator: Emma Grillo

item.title: A Stitch in Time, With His Help
item.description: Naomi Mishkin brought out the creative side of Graham Lazar, who even helped her make her wedding dress.
item.dc:creator: Rosalie R. Radomsky

item.title: On the Crosstown Bus, a Dramatic Meet Cute
item.description: Patrick Straub asked for Chelsea Toder’s number after they assisted a man who passed out on the M14 bus. Years later, they fell in love.
item.dc:creator: Julia Carmel

item.title: After She Gave an Inch, He Took Her Heart
item.description: Denise Pyfrom matched with Daniel White on Hinge only after lowering her minimum height preference on the dating app, but they connected over his service in the military.
item.dc:creator: Nia Decaille

item.title: An Invitation to Dinner Through Interoffice Mail
item.description: Andrew Dietz and Philip Melanson met seven years ago while both were in the Los Angeles page program of NBC Universal.
item.dc:creator: Nina Reyes

item.title: Committed to Global Health, and Each Other
item.description: Dr. Courtney Pedersen and Eddie Bearnot, who both work to promote health in others, overcame a medical crisis of their own.
item.dc:creator: Callie Holtermann

item.title: The Wave Emoji That Started It All
item.description: Kimberly Harris and William Browns Jr. connected with ‘the greatest, most awkward and most introverted romantic meeting of all time.’
item.dc:creator: Kristen Bayrakdarian

item.title: Finding Romance on a Quest for the ‘Perfect Milkshake’
item.description: Alyson Chavez and Joshua Stewart met in 2014 as recovering alcoholics. Their dedication to becoming sober spawned commitments to finding superior milkshakes and, later, to each other.
item.dc:creator: John Otis
